hierarchy.subdomain: Professional Ethics and Codes of Conduct

active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group discussion, debate the following scenario: A cybersecurity analyst discovers a high-impact vulnerability but has a financial stake in the vendor's stock. How should the Conflict Resolution Prioritization Framework guide resolution? Consider impacts on stakeholders, ethics canons, and organizational objectives. Support arguments with (ISC)² Code or NISTIR 8286B references.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in Professional Ethics under Conflict of Interest and Independence. Topic: Conflict Resolution Prioritization Framework (synthesized from NISTIR 8286B risk prioritization adapted for ethical COI resolution in cybersecurity decisions). Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Security And Risk Management > Professional Ethics and Codes of Conduct > Conflict of Interest and Independence > Identification and Management of Conflicts > Conflict Resolution Prioritization Framework. Sources: NISTIR 8286B (https://nvlpubs.nist.gov/nistpubs/ir/2023/NIST.IR.8286B.pdf); (ISC)² Code of Ethics (https://www.isc2.org/ethics); NIST CSF 2.0 (https://www.nist.gov/cyberframework); ISO 27001 Annex A.5 (ethics). Incorporate these pedagogical elements: - Learning Objectives: [insert array above] - Active Learning: [reference activities for scenario cards] - Scaffolding: [insert 4 layers above] – Tag each card to a layer. Generate 50 flashcards following this exact schema: Front: [Question] --- Back: Answer: [concise] Explanation: [detailed, with reference] Distractors: [if MCQ, list options A-D with correct marked] Metadata: {bloom_level: '...', scaffolding_layer: #, difficulty: '...', topic_hierarchy: '...'} Ensure: University pedagogy (progressive Bloom's), voter-aligned accuracy (ethics focus over general risk), completeness (full NIST steps + ethics), no fabrication. Output as numbered list 1-50. Vary question types per schema rules.
